author: @zazoomblog
title: Alfonso Signorini sta male in diretta al Grande Fratello | "Ho la febbre alta ora svengo come Anna Falchi"
text:
Alfonso Signorini sta male in diretta al Grande Fratello | “Ho la febbre alta ora svengo come Anna Falchi” Fanpage.it | 31 gen 2025 Alfonso Signorini ha affrontato la diretta del Grande Fratello di giovedì 30 gennaio con la febbre alta . I concorrenti si sono complimentati con lui per la professionalità, ma il conduttore ha confidato: "Non so come arrivo alla fine". Fanpage.it - Alfonso Signorini sta male in diretta al Grande Fratello: “Ho la febbre alta, ora svengo come Anna Falchi”
Leggi su Fanpage.it Alfonso Signorini sta male in diretta al Grande Fratello: "Ho la febbre alta, ora svengo come Anna Falchi" Signorini sta male al Grande Fratello: "Ho la febbre a 38.7"/ "Forse svengo in studio come Chiara Cainelli, fidanzata con Alfonso D'Apice? "Mi piace il suo cuore e il suo Grande Fratello, Signorini stronca Lorenzo per l'arroganza e poi minaccia: "Sempre più severi" "Ho un tumore" | Grande Fratello, annuncio drammatico della concorrente di Alfonso Signorini : distrutta dalla chemio Alfonso Signorini scioccato: il suo pupillo ridotto male | Tutto è precipitato in un secondo Signorini sta male al Grande Fratello: “Ho la febbre a 38.7"/ “Forse svengo in studio come Anna Falchi” - Alfonso Signorini sta male e conduce il Grande Fratello con la febbre: "Non so se arrivo alla fine senza svenire come Anna Falchi" ... (ilsussidiario.net) Grande Fratello, malore improvviso per Alfonso Signorini: corsa folle al pronto soccorso e diagnosi spietata - La diagnosi è stata spietata per Alfonso Signorini. Al Grande Fratello un brutto malore per il conduttore, ecco le condizioni ... (sicilianews24.it) Grande Fratello, Perla Vatiero lo rivela solo ora su Alfonso Signorini: “Mi ha fatto soffrire” - Utilizza dati di georilevazione precisi ed esegui una scansione attiva delle caratteristiche del dispositivo per l'identificazione. Questa operazione serve per archiviare le informazioni su un disposi ... (msn.com)

author: Brian Howell
title: Report: Former NFL QB Byron Leftwich joining CU Buffs' coaching staff
text:
Former NFL quarterback and offensive coordinator Byron Leftwich is joining the coaching staff at Colorado.
Jordan Schultz of Fox reported Wednesday that Leftwich is the latest addition to the star-studded staff hired by Buffs’ head coach Deion Sanders. CU has not confirmed the hire, but Schultz is represented by SMAC Entertainment, which also represents Sanders.
Earlier this week, Sanders told media: “We have a couple more huge moves we’ll probably make this week, maybe one next week that you’re going to really appreciate the understanding of how wonderful the staff is.”
It’s unclear what Leftwich’s role will be with the Buffs, but he has been on campus this spring.
Leftwich, 45, played for 10 seasons in the NFL before embarking on a coaching career. He most recently was the offensive coordinator for the NFL’s Tampa Buccaneers from 2019-22, working for three years with future Hall of Fame quarterback Tom Brady.
Although he hasn’t coached since 2022, Leftwich interviewed in January for the head coaching position with the New England Patriots. He also interviewed this offseason for the offensive coordinator job with the Seattle Seahawks.
A close friend of Sanders, Leftwich has been around the CU program a bit during Sanders’ previous two seasons. He has visited Boulder and Folsom Field to see the Buffs play.
As a player, Leftwich was a star at Marshall from 1998-2002, throwing for 11,903 yards, most of that in his final three years as a starter for the Thundering Herd. He was a two-time MAC offensive player of the year.
The seventh overall selection in the 2003 NFL Draft by the Jacksonville Jaguars, Leftwich played four seasons for them before moving on. He also played with the Atlanta Falcons (2007), Pittsburgh Steelers (2008, 2010-12) and Buccaneers (2009).
Leftwich was 24-26 as a starter in the NFL, throwing for 10,532 yards in his career. He was a backup for Pittsburgh when it won Super Bowl XLIII.
In 2016, Leftwich began his coaching career as an intern with the Arizona Cardinals. He spent three seasons in Arizona before becoming the offensive coordinator at Tampa Bay in 2019.
Brady signed with the Bucs in 2020, teaming with Leftwich to lead them to a victory in Super Bowl LV.
The NFL’s all-time leader in career touchdown passes, with 649, Brady had three 40-touchdown seasons in his 23-year career – two of those with Leftwich as his coordinator. Brady threw 40 touchdown passes in 2020 and a league-high 43 in 2021.
Leftwich is the latest in a long line of former NFL players and coaches that are now on the staff in Boulder, headlined by Sanders, a Pro Football Hall of Famer.
Defensive assistant Warren Sapp (hired last year) and running backs coach Marshall Faulk (hired this winter) are also Hall of Famers.
Former NFL players Domata Peko (defensive line coach), Andre Gurode (offensive line) and George Hegamin (offensive line) have also been hired this offseason.
Third-year cornerbacks coach Kevin Mathis and second-year receivers coach Jason Phillips also played in the NFL, while offensive coordinator Pat Shurmur and defensive coordinator Robert Livingston are longtime NFL coaches.

author: Meteorologist Will Haenni | News Channel 3
title: Winter Weather Advisory issued in West Michigan ahead of lake effect Friday
text:
WEST MICHIGAN — Ahead of expected lake effect snow, the National Weather Service issued a Winter Weather Advisory for Friday, Jan. 3, 2025.
The advisory was scheduled from 4 a.m. to 7 p.m. Friday for the following counties in West Michigan: Kalamazoo, Van Buren, Allegan, Barry, Ottawa, Kent, Muskegon, Newaygo and Oceana County.
Lake effect snow was expected to pick back up overnight through the start of Friday, continuing off and on through early Saturday morning.
Generally 1 to 4 inches of snow was forecast in the advisory area, but the strongest bands of lake effect may produce locally higher amounts in a few locations.
The greatest potential for some localized higher totals was across portions of Ottawa, Allegan, Van Buren and northwest Kalamazoo counties.
While true white out conditions are not anticipated, at least some reduced visibility can be expected due to wind gusts 25 to 30 mph Friday afternoon and evening.
High temperatures were forecast to reach the mid-20s Friday afternoon before falling into the upper teens through Saturday morning.
Colder than average temperatures settle in this weekend and are likely to dominate the forecast through at least mid-January.
Follow meteorologist Will Haenni on Facebook, X & Instagram. Have a weather-related question or story idea? Email Will at [wchaenni@sbgtv.com](mailto:wchaenni@sbgtv.com).

author: VNExplorer
title: Temperatures could hit 27C - but thunderstorms are on the way
text:
Fine, dry and sunny weather looks likely to last until the weekend but Britons are being warned not to get used to it. It was sunny in Hastings, East Sussex, on Thursday. Pic: PA High temperatures are expected today and over the weekend – but from Sunday, forecasters have warned the UK will experience “thundery breakdowns”. The south of England will see highs of 25C (77F) today, with the potential of temperatures reaching 26C (78.8F) on Saturday and possibly 27C (80.6F) on Sunday, according to the Met Office. See the latest weather forecast where you are This will beat the highest temperature of the year so far, after 24.3C (75.7F) was recorded at Heathrow and at St James’s Park in London on Thursday. Scotland and Northern Ireland are also expected to enjoy warmer springtime weather, with 22C (71.6F) forecast for Saturday in Glasgow. Alex Burkill, a Met Office meteorologist, said the warmer weather is down to high pressure that has been over the UK for much of this week. The forecaster warned of increased levels of UV and pollen and urged people to ensure they are protected. Fire services for Dorset and Wiltshire as well as Hampshire and the Isle of Wight issued wildfire warnings for this weekend. Can British farming survive? Failed asylum seeker pays to be returned from UK to France Section of M25 set to close Hampshire and Isle of Wight wildfire lead Larry Mackrell said: “Barbecues, campfires and bonfires can very easily spread out of control and drier, warmer weather increases the risk of wildfires, so it really is vital that people take extra care when visiting our beauty spots and green spaces.” By Sunday, the area of high pressure will pass to the east, making way for “more widespread and longer-lived spells of rain”, the Met Office said. Deputy chief meteorologist Tony Wisson said: “Many places will start fine and warm on Sunday, though it is likely to become cloudier from the west or southwest during the day. This will be accompanied by scattered showers, which could be heavy with thunder. The warm weather brought people outside near St Paul’s Cathedral in London. Pic: PA “On Monday we’re likely to see more widespread and longer-lived spells of rain, some of which will be heavy and thundery. This will also lead to a much cooler feel to the day.” Sky News weather producer Joanna Robinson said that along with the wind and rain, next week temperatures will drop back closer to the average for this time of year." } Global US CH SE DK NO NL BE UK DE FR FI IT AT ES PT PL IE GR CZ TR AE CA JP KR AR BR IN
UK Temperatures could hit 27C - but thunderstorms are on the way 10/05/2024 Fine, dry and sunny weather looks likely to last until the weekend but Britons are being warned not to get used to it.
It was sunny in Hastings, East Sussex, on Thursday. Pic: PA
High temperatures are expected today and over the weekend – but from Sunday, forecasters have warned the UK will experience “thundery breakdowns”.
The south of England will see highs of 25C (77F) today, with the potential of temperatures reaching 26C (78.8F) on Saturday and possibly 27C (80.6F) on Sunday, according to the Met Office.
See the latest weather forecast where you are
This will beat the highest temperature of the year so far, after 24.3C (75.7F) was recorded at Heathrow and at St James’s Park in London on Thursday.
Scotland and Northern Ireland are also expected to enjoy warmer springtime weather, with 22C (71.6F) forecast for Saturday in Glasgow.
Alex Burkill, a Met Office meteorologist, said the warmer weather is down to high pressure that has been over the UK for much of this week.
The forecaster warned of increased levels of UV and pollen and urged people to ensure they are protected.
Fire services for Dorset and Wiltshire as well as Hampshire and the Isle of Wight issued wildfire warnings for this weekend.
Can British farming survive?
Failed asylum seeker pays to be returned from UK to France
Section of M25 set to close
Hampshire and Isle of Wight wildfire lead Larry Mackrell said: “Barbecues, campfires and bonfires can very easily spread out of control and drier, warmer weather increases the risk of wildfires, so it really is vital that people take extra care when visiting our beauty spots and green spaces.”
By Sunday, the area of high pressure will pass to the east, making way for “more widespread and longer-lived spells of rain”, the Met Office said.
Deputy chief meteorologist Tony Wisson said: “Many places will start fine and warm on Sunday, though it is likely to become cloudier from the west or southwest during the day. This will be accompanied by scattered showers, which could be heavy with thunder.
The warm weather brought people outside near St Paul’s Cathedral in London. Pic: PA
“On Monday we’re likely to see more widespread and longer-lived spells of rain, some of which will be heavy and thundery. This will also lead to a much cooler feel to the day.”
Sky News weather producer Joanna Robinson said that along with the wind and rain, next week temperatures will drop back closer to the average for this time of year.
